intro: Psychotria boholensis, commonly known as Bohol's psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines, specifically the island of Bohol. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dark green, leathery leaves and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers. It is often found in lowland rainforests and is adapted to humid, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
